content.rendered:
There are several dog-friendly parks in Frederick, Maryland that allow dogs on a leash. Here are some options:

Baker Park – This is a large, picturesque park located in the heart of downtown Frederick. It features walking trails, a lake, picnic areas, and plenty of open space for you and your dog to explore.

Monocacy National Battlefield – This historic park offers scenic hiking trails and beautiful views of the Monocacy River. Dogs are allowed on the trails as long as they are on a leash.

Carroll Creek Linear Park – This is a popular park that features a 1.3-mile long walking path alongside a beautiful canal. It’s a great place to take your dog for a leisurely stroll.

Pinecliff Park – This park is located just outside of Frederick and features hiking trails, picnic areas, and a playground. Dogs are welcome as long as they are on a leash.

Ballenger Creek Park – This park offers walking trails, a playground, and a dog park, but also features areas where dogs on leash are allowed.

It’s always a good idea to bring water and waste bags with you when visiting a dog-friendly park. Also, make sure to check the park’s rules and regulations to ensure that you and your dog have a safe and enjoyable experience.
